title: cargo doc unexpectedly error'd out

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
I run `cargo build`, and `cargo test --workspace` without surprising behavior against this commit:

https://github.com/zingolabs/zingolib/pull/43/commits/16f751b25f9740ab73a9e9c176074643bc31ac4a

When I run `cargo doc` I get the following error:

```

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.61.0 (fe5b13d68 2022-05-18) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
end of query stack
error: could not compile `zingoconfig`
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
```
### Code

```Rust
cargo doc
```


### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->
